node.title: Trust in Science and Scientists Increased Globally, Poll Finds
node.description: An international survey found that the pandemic had enhanced public faith in researchers and science, up from 2018.

node.title: In China, Buying That Toy Gun Could Get You Arrested
node.description: San Cheng bought toy guns online as props for video game design. Then the police arrived, and he was jailed under China’s strict but messy gun laws.

node.title: Who Discovered the Highly Mutated Omicron Variant, Now Found in More Than a Dozen Countries?
node.description: The scientific community has praised the efforts of scientists from South Africa, Botswana and Hong Kong for their early detection of the variant of concern.

node.title: 'You Must Really Hate Trump,' a Furious Donald Trump Said to Bill Barr
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: What to Read: 4 New Illustrated Books
node.description: Here are four new graphic books we recommend this week.

node.title: Police Officer and 2 Women Are Killed in Atlanta Area
node.description: A suspect was shot and killed during an “exchange of gunfire” with officers responding to a domestic violence call, the police said. A 12-year-old boy and an officer were also injured.

node.title: Elon Musk Responds to Leaked Email Where He Warns SpaceX Faces Bankruptcy
node.description: The SpaceX and Tesla CEO said Raptor engine production was in "crisis" and that SpaceX would need "all hands on deck" to recover.

node.title: Majority of Americans Concerned About War With China in the Next Five Years: Survey
node.description: Just over half of those polled by a conservative think tank identified China as the United States' primary threat. Only 14 percent chose Russia.

node.title: Young woman was stabbed by own family because she was dating man of another faith, court told
node.description: A 21-year-old woman stabbed in an Adelaide suburban shopping centre car park on Tuesday morning was attacked and ambushed by members of her own family because she was dating someone outside her faith, a court hears.

node.title: The Patriots’ Dynasty May Not Be Over After All
node.description: New England thrashed the Tennessee Titans for its sixth consecutive victory, improving to 8-4 and taking over first place in the A.F.C. East.

node.title: What We Learned From Week 12 in the N.F.L.
node.description: Tom Brady has help in Tampa Bay, the Bengals are forcing the issue in the A.F.C. North race, and the Rams have some soul-searching to do.

node.title: Breaking Barriers: The Life of Lee Elder
node.description: Elder was the author of “a signature moment” in professional golf.

node.title: The Help-Wanted Signs Are Up for Transit Workers
node.description: Desperate to keep trains and buses rolling, New York’s transit agency offered retired transit workers $35,000 to go back to work for three months.

node.title: Can New Zealanders be confident about ethics in public service?
node.description: Analysis - New Zealand has a reputation for being transparent and free from corruption - but how true is this really?

node.title: Review finds 1 in 3 staff in Australian federal parliament experience sexual harassment
node.description: One in three people working in Australia's federal parliament have experienced some kind of sexual harassment there, according to a review of workplace culture.

node.title: The Next Challenge to Vaccinating Africa: Overcoming Skepticism
node.description: Vaccines are finally available in many African countries, but some people there, as well as in South Asia, are wary of taking them.

node.title: COVID case visited major Gold Coast shopping centre on Black Friday
node.description: The city is on high alert as Queensland Health confirms a new positive COVID case went to Robina Town Centre last week.

node.title: One in eight children found at risk of becoming child soldiers - report
node.description: One in eight of the world's children live in conflict zones where they are at risk of becoming child soldiers, a charity has warned, saying boosting school access is vital in fighting forced…

node.title: Rex, Georgia Mass Shooting as Police Officer Among 3 People Killed
node.description: Clayton County field training officer Henry Laxson was killed responding to a domestic violence call.

node.title: Shooting During Tennessee High School Basketball Game Leaves One Person Dead
node.description: One adult died and at least three others were injured during shooting at game at Humboldt High School.

node.title: Did Anyone Win the $102 Mega Millions Jackpot on 11/30/2021? Numbers and Results
node.description: Five lucky players each won $20,000 in the latest drawing. But did anyone bag the top jackpot prize last night?

node.title: Tel Aviv named the world's most expensive city
node.description: Rising prices for groceries, transport and alcohol push Tel Aviv to the top of the list in the latest global latest Cost of Living survey.

node.title: Winton offers shares at $3.88 a piece
node.description: Property developer Winton has announced plans for an initial public offering (IPO) shares ahead of its debut on the both the New Zealand and Australian sharemarkets.

node.title: Late Night Doesn’t Feel Great About Omicron
node.description: Moderna’s chief executive said scientists anticipate Omicron is “not going to be good.” Stephen Colbert called the sentiment “not comforting.”

node.title: Backyard bards changing landscape of New Zealand theatre
node.description: With Covid-19 restrictions impacting events around the country, a Nelson-based actor is bringing live theatre to the people.

node.title: Katy Perry's 'emotional response' to Australian designer aired in court battle
node.description: Singer Katy Perry's manager says she was upset when she made disparaging remarks about an Australian clothes designer in emails revealed in court.

node.title: Flash flooding warnings issued as storms lash Melbourne, state's north
node.description: Residents in some parts of Melbourne are being warned not to enter flood waters as slow-moving storms pelt the city with heavy rain and hailstones and lead to road closures.

node.title: Medicinal cannabis industry expects further consolidation after acquisitions
node.description: The medicinal cannabis industry is showing signs of maturity following recent acquisitions in the sector.

node.title: Covid-19 briefing: Children aged 5-11 may be able to get vaccine from end of January
node.description: Children aged 5-11 may be able to receive a vaccine dose from the end of January, pending official approval. Watch the government's latest briefing here.

node.title: Dunedin City Council wants plan that addresses coastal system 'as a whole'
node.description: Popular Dunedin sports fields may be sacrificed in a bid to protect the city's iconic southern coastline from the impacts of climate-related sea level rise and erosion.
